item.name: Browses (for <OBJECT> use either the <BROWSE> pointer or the name of the browse)
Forms (for <OBJECT> use either the <FORM> pointer or the name of the form)

section.description: The <OBJECT>.REFRESH_FIELDS() method executes the .REFRESH() method on each field object on a layout. Limitations: Desktop applications only.

section.title: Example
section.example: dim p as P dim t as P p = form.view("Customer") 'get a pointer to the primary table in the form t = p.Table_Get() 'start entering a new record, honoring field rules t.enter_begin(honor_field_rules) t.lastname = "Smith" t.firstname = "Simon" 'at this point, the form does not yet show the new data p.Refresh_fields()

section.description: Now the form shows the new data, but it is still in enter mode. Contrast this method with the <FORM>.RESYNCH() method which refreshes the form by re-displaying the data from the record in the record buffer. This method can only be executed if the form is in View mode.
